definition: to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
suddenly have a thought (idiom)/suddenly be inspired to do something

sentences.english: Is similar to the overwhelming majority thunderbolt, the network becomes the first disseminator .
sentences.chinese: 如同绝大多数突发事件，网络成为最先传播者。

sentences.english: One situation in particular kept me grateful to still be alive.
sentences.chinese: 有一次的突发状况让我一直庆幸自己还活着。

sentences.english: Sometimes the best ideas come to us when we're not focused on finding the best ideas.
sentences.chinese: 有时候一些金点子都是在我们不经意间突发灵感的。

sentences.english: My husband ever got a heart attack suddenly and made the heard-bridge operation.
sentences.chinese: 我丈夫曾经突发心脏病，并做过心脏搭桥术。

sentences.english: Customer emergency service mechanism is a significant measure to cope with power unforseen accidents.
sentences.chinese: 应急客户服务机制是应对电力突发事故的重要措施。

sentences.english: The 58-year-old Tubbs died from a brain hemorrhage .
sentences.chinese: 塔布斯突发脑溢血去世，年仅58岁。

sentences.english: His latest novel came to him while sitting in traffic in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 他最新的小说是在坐车时突发奇想，灵光闪现。

sentences.english: Differrent measures were required to taken for different types of emergency demand.
sentences.chinese: 突发需求不同，增长方式采取的措施也不同。

sentences.english: This includes planned disconnection as well as abrupt disconnection from the local network.
sentences.chinese: 包括计划好的断开以及本地网络的突发断开。

sentences.english: In 1923, Harding died of a sudden heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 1923年，哈丁死于突发性心脏病发作。

sentences.english: Migraines have been linked to seizures in recent studies.
sentences.chinese: 在最近的研究中偏头疼可能引起突发性疾病。

sentences.english: In case of emergency, each student has a single one day extension on a draft or revision that she or he can take.
sentences.chinese: 有突发情况时，每人只能延期一天提交草稿或修改稿。

sentences.english: Half a month after Jiang Hao's death, Jiang Chunyang came down with acute pneumonia.
sentences.chinese: 儿子走后半个月，姜春阳突发急性肺炎。

sentences.english: The odd dealer's sharp - edged batch work submittal can be solved by a introduction of resources reservation.
sentences.chinese: 引入资源预留的思想来解决散户的突发批量作业提交。

sentences.english: After identification, Xu suffering from sudden sharp schizophrenia.
sentences.chinese: 经鉴定，徐某患有突发性急剧性精神分裂症。

sentences.english: Men die of heart attacks while shoveling snow.
sentences.chinese: 在扫雪时，人类也会死于心脏病突发。

definition: to happen/to occur/to take place/to break out
to catch fire/to cook/to get angry
sudden death (in medicine, sporting competitions etc)
to send or deliver to the hospital
abbr. for 心肌梗塞[xin1 ji1 geng3 sai1], myocardial infarction/heart attack
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
